Filtering Profiles

Dell/KACE | Lead Design, Planning, Research | 2015

IT administrators needed a way to automate discovery and management of machines at scale — finding devices by location, idle state, OS, or security group, then pushing patches, drivers, or scripts.

The goal: eliminate manual targeting and enable reliable, repeatable automation for compliance, security, and efficiency across thousands of endpoints.

The Challenge

Admins needed to express complex, nested logic like:

“Battery present AND Security Group = Marketing AND (OS = Windows 7 OR (Time > 5 PM AND Idle))”

Existing tools forced flat lists or required scripting. There was no visual way to build, group, or validate these rules — leading to errors, delays, and fragile automation.

Research & Discovery

Through interviews with internal IT and Security Ops, we uncovered:

  • Admins spent hours manually filtering devices in spreadsheets
  • Nested conditions were common but impossible to model visually
  • Rules needed to be reusable, editable, and auditable

Early concepts were walked through remotely. Feedback shaped drag-reordering, grouping, and hover-state controls.

Solution: A Visual Rule Builder

I designed an intuitive, hierarchical interface that lets admins:

Key Interactions

  • Drag to reorder with visible handles
  • AND/OR toggles on all but last rule
  • Group/Ungroup with nested visual hierarchy
  • Hover affordances for delete and reorder

Impact

This visual rule engine transformed how IT teams automate at scale. Complex targeting became intuitive, reusable, and auditable — reducing errors and enabling proactive compliance and patching.
